page.title: 06ROWSLEY
page.content: The first feature confronting you in this beautiful country village is Rowsley Bridge,crossing the Derwent River.It is interesting to note that the bridge was widened in 1925 to accomodate the A6.There are three other bridges,Beeley Bridge,Wye Bridge and the railway viaduct. Not far from Beeley Bridge lies the only piece of historical interest in the village,Caudwell's Mill,built in 1851. The village has one inn,called the Peacock Hotel,and one public house, called the Grouse and Claret, which was converted from a Victorian house. Rowsley is a busy community and has very little to offer the tourists apart from its beauty. The village has only one shop,the Post Office and General Store,which caters for most needs of the villagers
